SENT.plain: A septum pellucidum cyst is defined as a cystic structure between the lateral ventricles, whose walls exhibit lateral bowing and are 10 mm apart or greater
This communication presents computerized tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) findings in six patients with septum pellucidum cysts, ages ranging from 1.5 to 47 yrs
The width of the cysts ranged from 13 to 23 mm, and their walls were laterally bowed
Only one patient had hydrocephalus, who was surgically treated
The remaining five patients only had intermittent headaches
It appears that further studies will be required to establish satisfactory diagnostic and therapeutic criteria for symptomatic or presumably symptomatic septum pellucidum cysts
